storyInfo: Although Kal'tsit managed to injure the Royal Guard, she too is injured. Given the circumstances, the Royal Guard decides to accept Kal'tsit's excuse. Despite her wounds, Kal'tsit reads the letter from Kazdel and decides her next destination.

attributes.content: *Hiss*...!
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: This technique...! Your body's rigidity and your judgment are nothing alike! What are you?!
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: (Howls)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Wait, Mon3tr!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Sorrowful wailing)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: You humiliated me, monster... This is what you deserve.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: Hmph!
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: Mon3tr, readjust. He's on his last legs.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: *Hiss*...
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: Those are no minor injuries, Royal Guard.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Likewise, traitor. You gave yourself an injection... You most certainly felt more than a poke in the arm.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: How peculiar. By appearance, you are no different from a veteran warrior. You possess all the traits necessary for you to be the perfect soldier, yet you rely on a beast... a monster for your power.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: The marks of battle can be covered, but the lands you've tainted can never bear fruit again. You should not have been so obstinate in your actions.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You fear... Certainly, if you truly know our secrets, then you should feel nothing but fear right now.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: 'Each Royal Guard is himself a nation.' The language of this saying is certainly colorful, but it also speaks the truth rather plainly.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Need I remind you? Your mask is fracturing. Reality is reacting to the evil that lingers in your body. The cage created by the ritual is beginning to fissure.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Or do you really believe that Victoria will turn a blind eye when an Ursus Royal Guard sets off a horrifying annihilation at a count's manor?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The Royal Guards' duty rests with all that exists in Ursus.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Don't make me laugh...! I don't need a traitor to teach me what my duty is.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: Tell me, then. Who do you serve? Ursus as it is now, or the great shadows of the past?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Tell me, Royal Guard. Do not bring shame to your title.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: —Tell me, what does the current Ursus Emperor think of the Pine Valley affair?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Or do you mean to tell me the seeds of that uprising, the origins of the crisis were all the will of the Emperor?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You were the cause of it all!
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: (Roars)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: —Feel free to keep deceiving yourself, but the truth is the young emperor is unaware of the events that transpired there.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You believe he has no need to know.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You... all of you seek a bygone era.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I won't judge whether this is correct, but when a Grand Duke is allowed to die in a political conflict, his death will always lead to an all new rebellion.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: This is not for you to judge.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: I can foresee the many consequences of his death. Some wished for him to die out of anger and their desire for so-called justice. They wanted his death in order to erase evidence and to cut off ties.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Others wished for him to live. They wanted him to continue to fulfill the duty he cannot remove himself from. Perhaps there were also those who wanted to keep a witness alive to serve as a stepping stone, to revolt against all those involved with the Third Army.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: It didn't matter whether he lived or not. The key was how the contradiction that followed was handled.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You don't mean...
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: It was up to an unremarkable Ursus assassin to kill the Grand Duke, someone she could never imagine to reach, out of personal grudge. Only then were those crimes finally erased, digested like grass seeds eaten by burdenbeasts.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: From the sound of it... You have great foresight. You mean to tell me you solved such a difficult problem as a mere citizen?
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: It was the best choice to make in order to keep Ursus's internal friction from developing any further.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Strange sound) Enough with the presumptuousness!
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: (Braying)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Traitor! Your excuse is an insult to Ursus!
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: Even if all is truly as you say and your actions benefit Ursus in thousands of ways, it was not your decision to make!
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: —Control yourself, Royal Guard.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I can smell your lies—How dare you claim you did this for Ursus?!
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: (It's spreading. Even though it's only a small demon shard embedded in that device, it is more than enough to level this entire manor.)
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: —The Valley of the Setting Sun has turned into a land of fear!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (If the Royal Guard wants my life... Mon3tr... Kill him immediately. That's far more effective than defense.)
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Even if the Empire's glory lasts another thousand years, those black lands no longer belong to Ursus! They are no longer part of this world!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Do you want to repeat your mishaps?! Do you want to drag the Empire into a war of unimaginable scale just because you lost control of yourself?!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You are just caught up in the former emperor's grand vision!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: *Hiss*...!
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: That moment, the fear in the air immediately boils into material substance.
Once the earthshaking emotional release comes to a halt, there remains nothing but a faint, ominous black glow emanating from the cracks of the Royal Guard's mask.
...Hufff...
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: Mon3tr, stop!
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Dissatisfied whining)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: What is this...? You let your chance get away. Your one and only chance...
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: I know your tactics. If I let Mon3tr attack, you would've pierced right through my chest with those black spikes of yours.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: *Hiss*... Looks like I need not test you anymore. You know like the back of your hand how the Royal Guards operate... You called me inhuman, and now you address me as man?
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: Suppose you still have a shred of my approval, it would have nothing to do with the will that you are executing right now.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: As long as you are still resisting, you remain a stalwart barricade of mankind. No one can take from you your honor of having been born a human.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: At the very least, before you find yourself fooled by that illusion that is destined to be destroyed.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: *Hiss*...
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: You are right... Indeed, there are many things I misjudged...
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: 'Knowledge' is how they grow in strength. To fend them off, the passing down of all knowledge of them was suppressed, an unwritten law of all nations.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: You are not a Sami Snowpriest, and you have nothing to do with Sargon's Eternal Army... Those who have the privilege of seeing the sights beyond Terra with their own eyes have always been at the top of their country's academic authority... Who are you?
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: Someone who fulfilled her duty.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And what is your duty?
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: You already know the answer in your heart. I did far less than you've accomplished.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Hmph...
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: I must admit... I have never met an outsider who knows the Royal Guards' secrets.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: The crimes you committed and the secrets you hold make you guilty beyond measure, but I have never met such a strange creature so evenly matched against me.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: (Taunting roars)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: *Hiss*... You are full of surprises... The mystery surrounding you worries me. It seems I must be more cautious when dealing with you.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: Let us pretend I am following your advice, 'Ursus citizen,' but do not forget that the Emperor's Blade is watching you.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: We don't have much time left. Ursus has not had the chance to catch its breath, but the moment the Count finds you, it will be plunged into a whole new whirlpool.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And it will happen, the people be damned.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Don't get so cocky... I simply did not expect it would take this much time to deal with a traitor.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: *Huff*...
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: You are worthy of my caution, traitor.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: It was your responsibility to guard Grand Duke Vanya, and finding the cause of his 'accidental' death is your one and only mission.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I ensured a quiet death for him. I then escaped from Ursus territory. Perhaps what I have done can't truly be considered a violation of Ursus's rights.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If so, it stands to reason that a life is too great a price. I trust all of you Royal Guards are capable of making a sensible decision.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You—
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: —Mmm!
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: Regardless, you must return to Ursus right this moment.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The pain may mean nothing to you, but, with your windpipe ripped by Mon3tr, you will suffocate—and drown in the demon's influence, even just a shard of its corpse.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Be quick about it. You might still make it back to Ursus territory in one piece.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: A target worrying about my wellbeing... This will indeed be a valuable experience.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: On top of that, you are a traitor, and you understand me far better than the men in our armies.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: I've never had such a long chat with a Royal Guard of the Emperor's Blade either.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: —How long have you lived? And who exactly are you?
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: I used to be the Grand Duke's private doctor, nothing more.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You should've killed me while I was making my escape.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Perhaps it isn't too late.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: I await the news of your success.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: —Hah!
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: You should've served your country, traitor! Your limitless potential could have flourished magnificently in Ursus, yet you betrayed it!
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: Sounds like I should feel bad about that.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: *Hiss*...
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: You love Ursus for how prosperous it is.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: In that case, I am sure you can see the parts of the country that rot in the sun.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: The newer generation may be slowly forgetting that prosperity, but, as time goes on and things grow worse, they will look back on its magnificence.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But is this truly beneficial to Ursus? Once the benefits war brings with it come to an end, will we be able to solve all of Ursus's problems?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Honor cannot feed the masses.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Is that an advice?
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: I could merely be talking to myself if it so pleases you. I belong to Ursus no longer.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You belong to Ursus no longer...
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: So it was the Grand Duke's personal doctor's decision that he passed. Her intention was to reduce his suffering.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: I hope you'll make it out of Victorian territory without a hitch.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: A shame...
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: If you understood what it is we are safeguarding, you could've contributed to its prosperity.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: Until next time.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: We will meet again.
attributes.name: 'Emperor's Blade'

attributes.content: Come back, Mon3tr... He's gone.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I need to... take care of these marks... Hmm.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit!
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: You should not have come here, Heidi.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: You're so badly hurt...! I brought a first aid kit. Ugh, how do you use this...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I can take care of myself.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Kal'tsit, what happened?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Emperor's Blade. Tell your father this name. That's all you have to do. It's nothing you need to worry about, yet.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: O-Okay, but was that man from Ursus? What is someone like him doing here?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: They are like the shadows of Ursus.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: And the size of their vast, dark shadows has to do with only the Empire's sun.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Even if you manage to fend off these shadows, the road beneath our feet remains shrouded in darkness, while the buildings in our surroundings remain unaffected.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: This too is Ursus, Heidi. This is a part of Ursus. The Empire's winter, the black snowflakes.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Before that, we need to deceive everyone else in the manor.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: We may have avoided the worst outcome, and he didn't scatter his 'Dominion' all across the soil here, but the marks he left behind will take some effort to cover up.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Mon3tr.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Dissatisfied whining)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: Huh—?!
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I-Is this yours...?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Kill two wild beasts and bring their bodies back as soon as you can.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Low roar)
attributes.name: Mon3tr

attributes.content: And... Heidi, contact your father immediately. I'll need assistance to put a lid on this the best we can...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: H-How are we going to do it?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: We need false witnesses, false leads, and all the bribes necessary. Perhaps there is no one out there who knows how to deal with the Mounted Police better than Thomson.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Okay, I understand—Why are you grasping at the snow?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: To lower my body temperature.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I was dragged into a fight between two wild beasts and fortunately made it out.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But I am afraid the guards will be punished for letting beasts into the garden.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: But those are no minor injuries! Are you still—
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: We managed to avoid the worst case scenario.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: If he had insisted on fighting me to the death... I'm afraid none of us could've gotten out of this alive.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Now, aside from that... find me a Messenger who can reach Sami.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Sami? It's so barren there... It will take a while.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: We have time. As long as she's alive, I'll get a reply... and I pray I'll get a reply.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Your wounds...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Hmm... Looks like my blood stained the letter.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Did something happen outside?
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Of course not, Count Vincent! Please do not avoid the subject. Tell us how you defeated the Grand Duke's hunters!
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: Haha, I had no intention to be disrespectful to the Duke, of course, but I lost my temper and could not well control myself in that competition.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: It was all because the hunter told me I should never have hired Savras and Zalaks.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: He even told me he took pride in hiring only Liberi housemaids and muscly Forte for the upkeep and defense of the mansion the Duke awarded to him.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: His words reminded me of an old gardener who once tended to our gardens. He was a Zalak, and he had been working here long before I was born, and I never found anything strange or unsatisfactory about that.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Oh, how progressive.
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: In the end, I was the one who shot down the fowlbeast, while the Duke's hunter missed his opportunity.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: You set a fine example for the rest of us, Count Vincent!
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: I should've saved the Duke some face, of course.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: When the Duke thinks so highly of you, what's wrong with putting your gallantry on full display?
attributes.name: Tipsy Businessman

attributes.content: Haha, you are right.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: There were the hunter, the bow, and the fowlbeast, but no one knows me better than myself.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.text: It was just as you predicted. The Sarkaz court summoned Her Majesty Theresa for an audience. Although the ancient bloodkin held General Theresis in high esteem, the Lord of the Banshees sent only the youngest successor...

...It was thanks to the General Theresis and the Military Commission that other countries were unable to interfere with Kazdel's rise to prominence. It was also under the General's supervision that they transported construction materials enough for several dozen regular nomadic city plates without issue.
The following is a summary of the past month's events.

attributes.content: (Theresa's handwriting...)
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.text: It's such a huge surprise. Who could've imagined that the Great Banshee's successor was a boy?

He is still very young, just a young boy by his looks. The Banshee's bloodline will keep him young for a long time. Despite his age, he was mouthing off Arts left and right. He is a natural-born Caster.
I can see the royal court change through him. The Sarkaz are heading toward a new stage. I can feel it.
Theresis frequently pulls all-nighters at the Commission, and their policies are going off track due to outside pressure. He's started to not listen to whatever I say.
A lot of us are worried. They are worried that once the other countries notice Kazdel's reunification, they will immediately wipe us off the map.
I know that you set your sights on the world at large.
But I am also hoping you would come back.
We must prepare ourselves to take on the challenges we will face in the future. I need you to help me accomplish this.

Aside from that, Rim Billiton's Engineering Department has something new to share. We discovered a set of ruins that match your description. There are only bits and pieces, and the project has reached a bottleneck as a result. The team may need more time to uncover everything. That said—
—Kal'tsit does the name... 'Rhodes Island' mean anything to you?

attributes.content: So soon...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Where will you go?
attributes.name: Elliot

attributes.content: Ursus...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Chernobog.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Haven't heard of that place before...
attributes.name: Elliot

attributes.content: What are you doing there?
attributes.name: Elliot

attributes.content: Why don't you come to Sami with me?
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: No, I will take Lyudmila to Siracusa.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I will also stop by Victoria on my way.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Isn't this your wish?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: I want you to live, Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Lillia

attributes.content: Kal'tsit?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Heidi, you and your father will continue our work in Victoria.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Our only objective is to prevent the cities that boast their honor and glory from falling to the Duke's unrest.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Dame Kal'tsit...?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Are you leaving...?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I have to leave sooner or later, Heidi.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Try not to make the Count suspicious. Let's head back to the party.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Dear God, what happened?! How are you injured so?!
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Get a doctor! Hurry!
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: (Uncle Richard...)
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: I saw something just now...! There were two fierce beasts! What was that? Were you attacked by the beasts?!
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: Oh, my. I heard that the Catastrophes a few years ago infected some of those fierce wild beasts...
attributes.name: Merry Noblewoman

attributes.content: I'm okay, ladies and gentlemen. It is just some simple flesh wounds. Heidi has already tended to my injuries.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: (Are you sure you can stand? I'm not sure I would've called it 'simple.')
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: How could something like this happen at one of my dinner parties?! Those useless guards!
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Please, lie down and get some rest. Someone, head to garden at once! I want to know what happened there!
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: No, Count Vincent, please let me go. You know my swordsmanship.
attributes.name: Pretentious Man

attributes.content: Richard, you are my guest... but very well. This is just the time for us to rely on your gallantry.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Come, Lady Kal'tsit. My personal physician will tend to your injuries. He will be here soon.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: My apologies, Count Vincent. I did not mean to disrupt your party.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: No, my lady. I am responsible for this mistake. I allowed an assassin to waltz right into my manor!
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Please don't look too much into this affair.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Oh... Right, I understand, though I am surprised you don't seem at all shaken by this.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Could you at least tell me who it was? I can't well sit here when these villains...
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Very well... If this assassin managed to deceive all those present here today, then indeed it isn't a matter that a mere noble should pry into.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Lady Kal'tsit, please promise me this.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Go ahead.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Please keep Thomson safe from these schemes. He is my dearest friend.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: He is no major player. He can't protect the entire country, but he can protect our own little Victoria.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: He can do what we nobles cannot. Therefore all I can do is to let him do what he must.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: You don't know the details of our plan, yet you harbor everyone nonetheless. I thank you for that.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Haha. Do I need to know? All I have to do is to play my role well... A fat fowlbeast awaiting his slaughter.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: But this is how he has always been ever since we were in school.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Lady Kal'tsit...
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Please accept my gratitude.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: You don't need to thank me when I have been deceiving you all along.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: As long as my family and the masses get to live another peaceful day—Let the whole world ridicule my foolishness.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Both you and I know it in our hearts.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Are you leaving so soon? You are still injured.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: These are just flesh wounds, fortunately.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Count Vincent, about the damage 'those two beasts' have done...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Right, I understand.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Kal'tsit...
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Looks like I should just leave the farewells to the youngsters.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: I will head back now. Everyone was shaken by the presence of the beasts.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: Please take care, Cleric Kal'tsit.
attributes.name: Count Vincent

attributes.content: The Count is right. The weight of the future is for the younger generation to bear, whether they are ready for it or not.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Is Uncle Vincent actually...?
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: The Victoria he protects may just be a remote corner of the countryside, but there is not an ounce of falsity to the peace he upholds.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Protecting your home—This is a truth that generations after generations of Victorian have worshipped.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Your father is trying his best, but...
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Winter is here.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Are you ready?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Will you be ready?
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: Heidi

attributes.content: Now go ask your father. He knows how to find me.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit

attributes.content: Perhaps we'll one day meet each other again somewhere.
attributes.name: Kal'tsit
